entry.title: Week 38, 2025: Active development across Melange, OxCaml parameterized libraries, package management, and testing infrastructure
entry.content:
Summary

14 new PRs opened including OxCaml parameters, Melange improvements, and testing enhancements, plus 6 merged PRs and infrastructure updates

Activity

  • New PRs opened this week include Antonio Nuno Monteiro introducing Melange module alias improvements (#12464), Rudi Grinberg fixing boot root module handling with include_subdirs qualified (#12476), @faukah proposing Nix flake cleanup (#12448), Ambre Austen Suhamy enabling concurrent testing with watch server (#12473), Ali Caglayan adding TUI horizontal mouse scrolling (#12386), and Antonio Nuno Monteiro testing include_subdirs module dependency handling (#12463)
  • OxCaml parameterized libraries implementation by @art-w adds new (parameters ...) field to library stanza requiring new compiler flag -parameter for each parameter (#12336)
  • Package management improvements by Marek Kubica include copying lock directories to build folder for enhanced rule processing (#12394) and Ali Caglayan implementing revision store caching with LMDB for 50% solving time improvement (#12188)
  • Merged contributions this week delivered Nix formatter updates by @faukah (#12449), Docker image generation fix by Sudha Parimala for manual triggers (#12474), dependency updates for GitHub Actions including checkout v5 and build provenance v3 (#12461, #12462), and boot system enhancements by Ali Caglayan including status line clearing (#12466), String.Map.find improvements (#12467), and -map flag removal by Rudi Grinberg (#12452)
  • Documentation and process improvements by Shon Feder updating CONTRIBUTING.md with development guidelines (#12440) and Etienne restructuring changelog format (#12472)
  • Issue reporting includes Calascibetta Romain requesting unikernel build support for dune pkg (#12475), Rudi Grinberg proposing vendor script rewrite from bash to OCaml (#12457), and Antonin DÃ©cimo requesting read-only promoted files feature (#12465)
entry.summary: Active development across Melange, OxCaml parameterized libraries, package management, and testing infrastructure

entry.title: Week 37, 2025: Active development with RPC improvements, Docker publishing setup, and package management enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

Intensive bootstrap testing infrastructure development and Windows package management bug fixes dominate ongoing work

Activity

  • Seven new PRs opened this week including changelog restructuring by Etienne (#12472), CONTRIBUTING.md updates by Shon Feder (#12440), overlapping executable stanza checking by Ali Caglayan (#12451), and flake.nix improvements by @faukah (#12448)
  • Bootstrap testing infrastructure reached completion with Rudi Grinberg implementing comprehensive test coverage (#12455, #12458, #12459, #12456, #12447, #12437) and Ali Caglayan adding test procedure verification (#12427)
  • Windows package management fixes addressed by Stephen Sherratt with multiple issue reports covering compiler fetching, executable extensions, and build tool compatibility (#12429, #12430, #12431, #12432, #12433)
  • OxCaml library parameters development continued by @art-w with parameters field addition for libraries (#12336) and related parameter implementation improvements
  • Code quality improvements delivered through RPC printing adjustments by Ambre Austen Suhamy (#12391), interface file additions by Rudi Grinberg (#12435), and parameter cleanup by @art-w (#12442)
entry.summary: Active development with RPC improvements, Docker publishing setup, and package management enhancements

entry.title: Week 36, 2025: Bootstrap system refactoring dominated with 18 PRs by Rudi Grinberg, OxCaml config support added, and documentation improvements with edit buttons
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive bootstrap refactoring with 18 PRs merged, ongoing OxCaml parameter support and TUI enhancements, plus package management improvements and code cleanup

Activity

  • Four new PRs opened this week include bootstrap testing by Ali Caglayan (#12427), horizontal mouse scrolling for TUI (#12386), OxCaml parameter implementation by Shon Feder (#12392), and package lock directory improvements by Marek Kubica (#12394)
  • Bootstrap system underwent major refactoring with Rudi Grinberg merging 17 PRs including typed configuration values (#12425), dependency order simplification (#12423), pattern matching improvements (#12419), and extensive code cleanup removing unused modules and functions (#12418, #12416, #12415, #12414)
  • Code maintenance activities included removing unused Opam modules and Cmdliner components, updating uutf dependency, disabling problematic exec-watch tests (#12412), and Nix flake cleanup (#12426)
  • Package management enhancements with development tool classification fixes and ongoing work on lock directory copying to build folders for improved build isolation
entry.summary: Bootstrap system refactoring dominated with 18 PRs by Rudi Grinberg, OxCaml config support added, and documentation improvements with edit buttons

entry.title: Week 35, 2025: Major bootstrap refactoring by Rudi Grinberg, CI improvements with 25-minute speedup, and enhanced cram test infrastructure
entry.content:
Summary

Bootstrap system undergoes major refactoring for module system improvements, while new PRs opened focus on OxCaml features and exec-watch fixes

Activity

  • Three major new PRs opened including Ali Caglayan's exec-watch fix (#12360), cram lexer location tracking (#12335), and @art-w's parameterized library support for OxCaml (#12336)
  • Bootstrap system modernization led by Rudi Grinberg with 15+ merged PRs including module system improvements (#12362, #12364, #12367), code modernization using newer OCaml features (#12355, #12357, #12365), and infrastructure improvements (#12353, #12356, #12358)
  • CI infrastructure breakthrough by Ali Caglayan achieving 25-minute speedup through Nix job caching (#12346) and adding Cygwin support (#12325, #12326)
  • Testing reliability improvements including cram test isolation (#12329), timeout handling (#12337, #12344), and comprehensive lexer tests (#12334)
  • Docker automation merged by Sudha Parimala enabling automatic image publishing during releases (#12252)
  • OxCaml integration continued with Jon Ludlam's compiler option support (#12236) and Ambre Austen Suhamy's RPC watch server formatting capabilities (#12064)
entry.summary: Major bootstrap refactoring by Rudi Grinberg, CI improvements with 25-minute speedup, and enhanced cram test infrastructure

entry.title: Week 34, 2025: Major release 3.20.0 shipped with numerous bootstrap improvements, new Melange directory target support, and copy-on-write file operations
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive bootstrap refactoring by Ali Caglayan, Melange improvements, package management optimizations, and release preparation

Activity

  • Major Dune 3.20.0 release published on August 19 with numerous enhancements including test aliases, inline test improvements, OS detection variables, and BLAKE3 digest migration (release 3.20.0)
  • Bootstrap system refactoring through 40+ commits by Ali Caglayan modernizing argument generation, module handling, file scanning, and configuration management (51e4fa1, ca1422d, 910aca5)
  • Package management caching with ongoing #12188 by Ali Caglayan introducing LMDB-based revision store caching to reduce solving time by 50%
  • Lock directory parsing optimization addressing performance issues identified by @v-gb in #12248 where sexp decoding caused 8-second build delays
  • Fiber system improvements including new Fiber.Lazy implementation and array-backed Fiber.Var refactoring by Rudi Grinberg (#12222, #12235)
  • CI infrastructure updates with dependabot configuration by Ali Caglayan and GitHub Actions workflow improvements (#12221)
entry.summary: Major release 3.20.0 shipped with numerous bootstrap improvements, new Melange directory target support, and copy-on-write file operations

entry.title: Week 33, 2025: Code modernization through new libraries fs-io and top-closure, plus Tangled repository support
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened for package management improvements, plus extensive test reorganization and library modernization

Activity

  • Package management caching development by Ali Caglayan introducing LMDB-based revision store caching to reduce solving time by 50% (#12188)
  • OCaml 5.4 CI support preparation by Rudi Grinberg updating build infrastructure (#12169)
  • Test suite reorganization with multiple test directories consolidated including build-info, cram, describe, dune-init, dune-site, exec, and select-field tests for better maintainability
  • Melange improvements with runtime asset promotion in source builds for better JavaScript compilation workflows
  • Vendor library updates including ocaml-re update and removal of dune-re for improved regular expression handling
  • Bootstrap infrastructure modernization with let syntax extension usage and cleaner dependency management
entry.summary: Code modernization through new libraries fs-io and top-closure, plus Tangled repository support

entry.title: Week 32, 2025: Significant Melange features with in-source promotion and TUI improvements alongside package management fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple refactoring efforts and package management improvements with focus on Melange ecosystem enhancements

Activity

  • Melange ecosystem improvements by Etienne including in-source promotion support (#12102) and module system deprecation warnings (#12123)
  • TUI enhancements by Ali Caglayan adding message wrapping functionality (#12140) for better user experience
  • Target promotion improvements with automatic directory creation eliminating manual setup requirements (#12145, #12144)
  • Build system fixes including BSD compilation issues (#12121) and dune-rpc dependency management (#12133)
  • Code refactoring efforts streamlining module location handling (#12146, #12147, #12148) and file kind abstractions (#12126)
  • Test infrastructure improvements with configurable lock directory locations (#12129) and environment variable export by Sudha Parimala (#12125)
entry.summary: Significant Melange features with in-source promotion and TUI improvements alongside package management fixes

entry.title: Week 31, 2025: Experimental library_parameter stanza for OxCaml, cram test timeouts, Melange 1.0 support, and package management improvements
entry.content:
Summary

OxCaml parameterized library tutorial draft, package management bug reports, and architectural refactoring work

Activity

  • New OxCaml tutorial draft opened by Etienne for library parameter documentation covering parameter implementation, parameterized libraries, and instantiation (#12111)
  • Package management bug reports including compiler package rebuilding with -j flag by Stephen Sherratt (#12103) and discussion of package release workflows by Shon Feder (#12099)
  • Architectural refactoring efforts by Ali Caglayan including Unixerror and Filekind module separation (#12119, #12118), Usermessage.todyn implementation (#12117), and cleanup of unused modules from Dune_rules (#12112)
  • Build system improvements including Archivedriver cleanups (#12114), Mlsources cosmetic improvements (#12113), and test re-enablement for exec-watch functionality (#12093)
  • CI and development workflow enhancements with 60-second timeout additions (#12092), git helper function environment variable replacements (#12105), and bootstrap ocamlfind output improvements (#12090)
entry.summary: Experimental library_parameter stanza for OxCaml, cram test timeouts, Melange 1.0 support, and package management improvements

entry.title: Week 30, 2025: Melange Syntax 1.0 release, OCaml 5.0+ `-cmi-file` support, and bug fixes for error reporting
entry.content:
Summary

RPC formatting improvements merged, platform-specific crash reports, and documentation requests opened

Activity

  • RPC formatting enhancement by Ambre Austen Suhamy allowing formatting while watch server is running was merged after addressing thread safety concerns (#12064)
  • Platform-specific crash investigation for ppc64 Darwin segmentation fault during bootstrap process reported by Sergey Fedorov with community debugging assistance (#12063)
  • Documentation improvement request by Louis for --print-metrics option to help users understand the performance data displayed (#12069)
  • Copy-on-write cache support proposal by Jan-Oliver Kaiser was closed with implementation moved to separate PR for cp --reflink functionality on supporting filesystems (#12071)
  • Long-standing package lock issue with cross-device link errors in Docker environments continues affecting users with bind mounts (#11644)
  • Multiple test infrastructure improvements by Ali Caglayan including NixOS compatibility fixes and CI pipeline enhancements for better cross-platform testing
entry.summary: Melange Syntax 1.0 release, OCaml 5.0+ `-cmi-file` support, and bug fixes for error reporting

entry.title: Week 29, 2025: New --alias flags for Windows compatibility, improved package management submodule support, and core architecture refactoring
entry.content:
Summary

Architecture refactoring with module moves to Stdune, Melange build improvements, JS-of-OCaml enhancements, and CI fixes

Activity

  • Core module refactoring by Ali Caglayan moving Executionenv, Terminalsignals, and Flock modules to Stdune library for better organization (#12048, #12047, #12045)
  • Melange build system improvements with target directory handling refactoring and output organization (#12052, #12051)
  • JS-of-OCaml shapes support implementation for improved JavaScript compilation (#10767)
  • Melange build benchmarks optimization fixing performance measurement issues (#12053)
  • CI infrastructure improvements including 32-bit package listing updates and test dependency fixes (#12049, #12031, #12036)
  • Testing enhancements with git user configuration fixes, bootstrap warning removal, and RPC promotion capabilities showcase (#12034, #12037, #12029)
  • Package management testing including dune-site integration reproduction test (#11998)
entry.summary: New --alias flags for Windows compatibility, improved package management submodule support, and core architecture refactoring

entry.title: Week 28, 2025: New dune describe location command, TUI improvements, blake3 assembly implementation, and package management enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened including oxcaml parameter support and TUI improvements, with melange runtime dependencies fix merged

Activity

  • TUI enhancement PR opened by Ali Caglayan adding click-to-open file functionality for error messages (#11992)
  • OxCaml parameter implementation PR opened by Etienne for parameterized libraries support, currently closed but represents ongoing oxcaml feature development (#12002)
  • Melange runtime dependencies fix merged by Antonio Nuno Monteiro allowing melange.runtime_deps to depend on directory targets (#12006)
  • Package management infrastructure improvements with lock directory handling, overlapping workspace checks, and dev tools installation support by Rudi Grinberg and Stephen Sherratt
  • Build system refactoring including removal of Dune_util.Prog module and cram test execution improvements (#12019, #11916)
  • Testing infrastructure expansion with new cram test scenarios and ocamldep alias handling (#12004, #12020)
entry.summary: New dune describe location command, TUI improvements, blake3 assembly implementation, and package management enhancements

entry.title: Week 27, 2025: New testing and alias features merged, TUI improvements, and package management bug fixes
entry.content:
Summary

RPC improvements, package management fixes, and extensive testing infrastructure work

Activity

  • RPC formatting issue resolved by Ambre Austen Suhamy after reporting problem with dune rpc status displaying information in single column format (#11950, #11951)
  • Package management debugging by Ali Caglayan to fix dune pkg outdated runtime error affecting users with :with-dev-setup dependencies (#11188, #11962)
  • TUI stability improvements with Ali Caglayan fixing tab character crashes in terminal interface and enhancing visual presentation (#11979, #11982, #11983)
  • Testing infrastructure expansion with Stephen Sherratt working on concurrent test execution during watch server operation (#11900)
  • Package management user experience discussion by Mathieu Barbin regarding build command differences between release and development modes (#11948)
  • Melange ecosystem support enhanced by Antonio Nuno Monteiro preventing unnecessary empty module wrapper file generation (#11987)
  • Code organization improvements including DuneRPC refactoring, file reading optimizations, and pkg toolchain simplification across multiple commits
entry.summary: New testing and alias features merged, TUI improvements, and package management bug fixes

entry.title: Week 26, 2025: Dune runtest improvements for absolute paths and context selection, plus Cram test process management fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Issue discussions focused on pure rule execution without OCaml compiler and foreign stub debug flag handling

Activity

  • Pure rule execution request opened by @kemsguy7 to allow dune to execute write-file and copy rules without requiring OCaml compiler installation (#11939), identified as duplicate of existing proposal
  • Foreign stub debug flag issue reported by FrÃ©dÃ©ric Recoules where dune overwrites user-provided -g0 flags by automatically appending -g (#11941), with fix provided by Ali Caglayan
  • License clarification completed for Jerry James regarding LGPL components in src/dune_pkg and src/sat directories (#11603)
  • Cram test subprocess issue resolved for Sebastian Willenbrink where background tasks were not terminated after test completion (#11820)
entry.summary: Dune runtest improvements for absolute paths and context selection, plus Cram test process management fixes

entry.title: Week 25, 2025: Significant concurrency improvements with dune exec concurrent execution and OxCaml support integration
entry.content:
Summary

Package management fixes for portable lockdirs and documentation corrections for repository configuration

Activity

  • Package management improvements with Stephen Sherratt fixing portable lockdir issues where OCaml compiler was incorrectly built with --disable-native-compiler flag (#11926)
  • Documentation correction by Marek Kubica fixing lock_dir stanza documentation that incorrectly mentioned :default instead of proper repository names (#11921)
  • Release completion with Etienne closing 3.19.1 release tracker after all tasks were finished and merged (#11895)
  • Bug fixes for portable lock dirs breaking depext resolution by Marek Kubica (#11824)
entry.summary: Significant concurrency improvements with dune exec concurrent execution and OxCaml support integration

entry.title: Week 24, 2025: Release 3.19.1 with dune exec fix, RPC warning, boot status line fix, and test organization improvements
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for concurrent test running, plus extensive test organization and dependency rule refactoring

Activity

  • New PR opened by Stephen Sherratt for allowing tests to run concurrently with the watch server (#11900), addressing 338 additions and 190 deletions across 18 files but currently has merge conflicts
  • Release 3.19.1 published by Etienne reverting dune exec behavior changes from 3.19.0 that caused issues (#11879, fixes #11870, #11867, #11881)
  • Test suite organization improvements with action tests moved to dedicated directory (#11917), cache tests reorganized (#11918), ocamldep tests consolidated (#11915), and foreign library tests split for clarity (#11909)
  • Dependency rules refactoring with substantial cleanup and simplification of dependency handling code (#11911, #11908) affecting compilation context and ocamldep functionality
  • CI infrastructure updates including OCaml version bumps to 5.3.0 for MSVC and MinGW environments, plus reorganization of CI matrix configuration
entry.summary: Release 3.19.1 with dune exec fix, RPC warning, boot status line fix, and test organization improvements

entry.title: Week 23, 2025: Dune exec behavior reverted, portable depexts support added, internal refactoring, and RPC warning improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Internal refactoring of dune_lang module structure, CI improvements, and test infrastructure updates

Activity

  • Module organization refactoring by Rudi Grinberg moving core components to dunelang including Modeconf (#11890), includesubdirs (#11887), stanzacommon and alias_conf (#11885)
  • CI infrastructure improvements by Ali Caglayan bumping OCaml version to 5.3 (#11788) and switching CI to use local dune version (#11883)
  • Test suite updates including promoted module tests (#11889), disabled inline-tests on macOS for jsofocaml (e32c9be), and improved foreign library C++ compilation tests
  • OxCaml support PR merged adding testing infrastructure and compiler variant detection (#11826)
entry.summary: Dune exec behavior reverted, portable depexts support added, internal refactoring, and RPC warning improvements

entry.title: Week 22, 2025: BLAKE3 digest implementation, new OS variables, and implicit transitive deps option introduced
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for dune format-dune-file improvements, alongside ongoing BLAKE3 and compiler feature work

Activity

  • New PR opened by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r for dune format-dune-file to use Dune lang version of current project, addressing formatting consistency issues (#11865)
  • BLAKE3 implementation completed by Rudi Grinberg with vendored blake3 mini library and full integration replacing MD5 digests across the build system
  • Platform detection enhancements by Stephen Sherratt setting default platform for package dependency solving in tests (02f3995bba6f42bf3b7c2044dae5ef849fd7d72f)
  • Test infrastructure improvements including flake test disabling and runtest refinements (82bbef1c62e6f402e22823481c3bde35429a2bad, 5315210d8dffd7d2109212ffe1e18409763fc4e3)
entry.summary: BLAKE3 digest implementation, new OS variables, and implicit transitive deps option introduced

entry.title: Week 21, 2025: Dune 3.19.0 release with pkg-config fixes, foreign library improvements, and new dune-project documentation structure
entry.content:
Summary

Major refactoring moved core modules between libraries and OxCaml testing support was opened for future integration

Activity

  • OxCaml testing suite support opened by Etienne introducing %{oxcaml_supported} variable, OCaml_toolchain extensions, and GitHub Actions integration (#11826)
  • Library reorganization with extensive refactoring moving modules between dunerules, dunelang, and new source library including Duneenv, Copyfiles, Enabledif, Menhirenv, and workspace management (5ac0a987, 3cbc1858)
  • Filesystem integration merging dunefilesystemstubs into stdune for better file system operation consolidation (59e2647d)
  • Test infrastructure improvements with uniform comment styles, cram stanza relocations, melange test organization, and flaky test management (10d5c47c, baad54c3, 8232e34b)
  • Code cleanup removing dead code including Lib_info.user_written_deps and unused logic from exec module (0ca7281b, bd1d76bb)
entry.summary: Dune 3.19.0 release with pkg-config fixes, foreign library improvements, and new dune-project documentation structure

entry.title: Week 20, 2025: Major internal refactoring to consolidate modules into Dune_lang with improved dune subst command functionality
entry.content:
Summary

Comprehensive internal refactoring effort consolidating core modules into Dune_lang with significant source tree construction improvements

Activity

  • Major module consolidation into Dune_lang with systematic moves of Coq_env (022d71eeaeeb53390217e9943ad74333c27db519), Ocaml_flags (fae2a41285f585cec8c04a796cb35913095e9699), Foreign_language (cef0bf097abb7aad7d382e4104d12af2ede50891), File_binding and Dune_project (c3648f48913a25f79bb2693db44ec7532a822793), Link_flags (a6c9a05c4371fa94c4d742f7f2075c3bbb9f0887), and pin frontend (aa1a3e2c33ca248d8f70dfb4e1af7d721144f8b2)
  • Source tree construction overhaul with top-down approach implementation replacing previous methods (f07b6a2bd3503f7d5855d37fb8005aed40827c21), involving 552 lines of changes to source tree handling
  • Testing infrastructure improvements including comprehensive foreign stubs test suite reorganization with new dedicated test files for archive naming, bytecode executables, Dune 2 compatibility, missing C files, and multiple stub handling scenarios (df7b807e9afde920ef6b15370d086b27280a584d)
  • WASM toolchain updates with OCaml 5.2 compatibility and future wasmofocaml release preparations (791543fcbab90b6daf17921bfe38057d895a2176, e8d793e0d915e4afaa65d84d2d612e733cb459fb, f0d373079223fc63b26a1b0568772721eb7e25aa)
  • Code organization cleanup including Dune_file0 rename to Dune_file (95dc808fe6c746740449fd0118af0e047165aa4f), Path.explode removal (d28cbf9da33a6807785afe9fc08bdab6721ccb81), and Dune_project.File_key inlining (b08aa0540bef0805ca8555242a07896de78c6108)
  • Package management enhancements with improved wrapping (a34bb74bedfc7d60f8ba60ce4b404ca9cd254652) and comprehensive structural reorganization affecting 99 files with 1,849 additions and 1,710 deletions
entry.summary: Major internal refactoring to consolidate modules into Dune_lang with improved dune subst command functionality

entry.title: Week 19, 2025: Major refactoring week with new workspace depopt selection, RPC concurrency, and dune subst fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Extensive code refactoring focused on moving modules to dune_lang and creating new source library

Activity

  • Major code organization with modules moved from dune_rules to dune_lang including Module_name, Lib_mode, Preprocess, and other core language constructs (532724bd19c9, 9c3901a7731, db2b503b70e4)
  • New source library introduced to better organize source tree handling and file operations (7e85b12613c1)
  • Package management refactoring including improvements to solver, lock file handling, and dependency resolution (c8d09d047a2d, 67117c3059af)
  • dune exec improvements with simplified implementation using Process.run and better exit code handling (6fa1f6ea66b4)
  • Removed unused opam code cleaning up approximately 2000+ lines of obsolete vendor code (cee61bf5ca88)
entry.summary: Major refactoring week with new workspace depopt selection, RPC concurrency, and dune subst fixes

entry.title: Week 18, 2025: Version 3.18.2 released with foreign_library extra_objects support and JS effects configuration features
entry.content:
Summary

Heavy development week with 63+ commits focusing on refactoring, package management improvements, and testing infrastructure

Activity

  • Package management development with refactoring of package conversion from solving (#11755), removing pointless first class modules (#11754), and new toolchain variables test coverage (toolchain-variables.t)
  • JavaScript ecosystem improvements through Melange rules refactoring with extracted Output_kind.t (#11740), improved code sharing for runtime dependencies (#11743), and cleaned up test coverage
  • Internal code quality improvements including extensive inline tests refactoring (#11750, #11749), modules API cleanups, and removal of coverage instrumentation (#11747, #11699)
  • Build system maintenance with version bump to 3.18 (#11478), CI improvements including Nix build optimizations (#11697), and disabled flaky tests for stability
  • Library management enhancements with simpler virtual library tracking (#11713), improved module handling (#11714, #11715), and lib_info path mapping fixes (#11691)
entry.summary: Version 3.18.2 released with foreign_library extra_objects support and JS effects configuration features

entry.title: Week 17, 2025: Extensive internal refactoring and code organization across build rules, ctypes, and bootstrap components, with bug fixes for package management and user rules
entry.content:
Summary

Comprehensive internal refactoring across library rules, ctypes, and executable generation with improved code organization

Activity

  • Major refactoring effort across build system components with Rudi Grinberg leading systematic improvements to library rules (99d324456, b4bc84f42), executable rules (33fe7f645), and foreign stubs handling (7566dbdf3)
  • Ctypes integration improvements with simplified rules and consolidated header generation (c5304d71b, a024eafb2)
  • Test organization restructuring with dedicated directories for exec, foreign-stubs, sandbox, and project-source test suites (64d7546949, 5b06c02f7a)
  • Bootstrap system enhancements by Rudi Grinberg with improved module mapping and garbage collection fixes (8adad6053)
  • Development environment updates including OCaml 5.3 integration in Nix configuration (7c79f82b0)
entry.summary: Extensive internal refactoring and code organization across build rules, ctypes, and bootstrap components, with bug fixes for package management and user rules

entry.title: Week 16, 2025: Released dune 3.18.1 with pkg-config fix and merged typo detection feature for package dependencies
entry.content:
Summary

Release of dune 3.18.1 with pkg-config personality flag fix and ongoing issue discussions about overlapping executables

Activity

  • Dune 3.18.1 release published by Etienne fixing missing --personality flag in pkgconfig invocations that prevented library discovery in some contexts (#11619)
  • Package management submodules issue reported by Sacha Ayoun regarding dune's handling of git submodules in pinned dependencies, later resolved by switching to git subtree (#11606)
  • Overlapping executables bug under investigation by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r where dune build @check fails mysteriously with overlapping executables while dune build @all succeeds (#11518)
entry.summary: Released dune 3.18.1 with pkg-config fix and merged typo detection feature for package dependencies

entry.title: Week 15, 2025: Reimplemented `dune exec -w` feature with new binary dev tools flag and pkg-config fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Package management submodules issue resolution and comprehensive test coverage improvements

Activity

  • Package management submodules issue was resolved where Dune failed to recursively initialize git submodules for pinned dependencies, reported by Sacha Ayoun (#11606)
  • Test coverage expansion for dune exec -w functionality including segfault handling, stdin input processing, and failure scenarios across multiple new test files
  • macOS compatibility addressed by disabling problematic dune exec -w tests on macOS platform (9ebfcb2)
entry.summary: Reimplemented `dune exec -w` feature with new binary dev tools flag and pkg-config fixes

entry.title: Week 14, 2025: Dune 3.18.0 release with C/C++ compiler improvements and package management fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Release preparation and infrastructure improvements with template cleanup and dependency updates

Activity

  • Release preparation completed for Dune 3.18.0 with changelog updates and version bumps across project files (08416b4)
  • Infrastructure updates including GitHub Actions migration to setup-ocaml@v3 for Mirage builds (da74ce6), dune-release upgrade to 2.1.0 (3f3e829), and Nix build improvements with unzip dependency (cc639e0)
  • Code cleanup with dead code removal from Dune_lang.Bindings module (f897bf8) and template cleanup (d983d57)
  • Documentation maintenance with CODEOWNERS file updates (cf611d3)
entry.summary: Dune 3.18.0 release with C/C++ compiler improvements and package management fixes

entry.title: Week 13, 2025: Dune focused on UI improvements, Windows reliability, and package management error handling
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/dune - Week 13, 2025
entry.summary: Dune focused on UI improvements, Windows reliability, and package management error handling

entry.title: Week 12, 2025: Package management improvements with zip archive support and version constraint fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Package management system enhancements focused on archive format support and version constraint resolution

Activity

  • Package management infrastructure improvements by @art-w with comprehensive zip archive support implementation (9bdbdaae880) and Etienne Millon fixing version constraint handling for local packages (6d1e608f7b)
  • Archive extraction capabilities expanded with new Archive_driver module supporting both tar and zip formats, including intelligent format detection based on file extensions and fallback extraction strategies when preferred tools are unavailable
  • Local package version semantics refined to use dev version by default when no explicit version is specified, improving solver compatibility and enabling proper constraint resolution for self-referencing packages
  • Test infrastructure enhanced by Etienne Millon with cache permissions reproduction test (0a80aa31be) addressing directory target permission issues
entry.summary: Package management improvements with zip archive support and version constraint fixes

entry.title: Week 11, 2025: Package management improvements and documentation updates with enhanced pin command support
entry.content:
Summary

Limited activity focused on package management improvements and user experience enhancements

Activity

  • Package pinning enhancements implemented with new command source tracking in local packages, allowing proper handling of build and install commands from opam files when pinning packages (a7e68e3)
  • Test coverage expanded with reproduction test for symlinks in directory targets addressing issue behavior (1c359df)
  • Documentation quality improvements including standardized C function signatures and updated installation procedures (d282a96, a508133)
entry.summary: Package management improvements and documentation updates with enhanced pin command support

entry.title: Week 10, 2025: Package management improvements with better OPAM conflict handling and undefined variable fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Two new bug reports opened regarding build system behavior and error message clarity

Activity

  • Louis reported unclear error messages in copy action failures, requesting better pinpointing of which rule and action parts cause errors (#11506)
  • NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r identified mysterious check failures with overlapping executables where dune build @check fails but dune build @all passes (#11518)
entry.summary: Package management improvements with better OPAM conflict handling and undefined variable fixes

entry.title: Week 9, 2025: Merlin flag ordering fixes and Windows error code improvements merged alongside package solver enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

Single issue opened regarding copy action error messages alongside CI maintenance work

Activity

  • Copy action error reporting issue opened by Louis highlighting unclear error messages when copy actions fail, particularly in distinguishing between with-stdout-to and copy command failures (#11506)
  • CI maintenance included disabling failing tests and fixing wasmofocaml configuration to maintain build stability (07a2e1a98f65, 94841d78867e)
entry.summary: Merlin flag ordering fixes and Windows error code improvements merged alongside package solver enhancements

entry.title: Week 8, 2025: None
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/dune - Week 8, 2025
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/dune - Week 8, 2025

entry.title: Week 7, 2025: Package management improvements with http+tar pinning support and Melange version upgrade to 5.0
entry.content:
Activity

  • Code maintenance work dominated the week with Etienne Millon upgrading to ocamlformat 0.27.0 (#11469), removing unused fmt library (#11468), and cleaning up unused opam libraries (#11472)
  • Package management improvements by Rudi Grinberg including local formula matching reduction (#11465), context type fix (#11471), and boot system updates (#11464)
  • JavaScript toolchain maintenance with JSOO version test promotion (#11480) and documentation build fixes (#11479)
  • Build system improvements including rules API cleanup (#11466), libs.ml addition for checking (#11467), and test promotion for describe-workspace-pp (#11473)
entry.summary: Package management improvements with http+tar pinning support and Melange version upgrade to 5.0

entry.title: Week 6, 2025: Active week with directory targets fixes, inline test improvements, and package handling enhancements across 23 commits
entry.content:
Summary

Heavy refactoring week focused on package management optimizations, opam solver improvements, and internal architecture cleanup

Activity

  • Package management refactoring delivered major improvements including opam buffer reuse for parsing (#11302), specialized string functions for parser string cache (#11350), and buffer string reading optimizations (#11301)
  • Concurrent opam solver implementation completed with fiber-based concurrent loading of opam files (#11362), replacing table with fiber cache for better performance
  • Internal architecture cleanup including removal of unused mutex code (#11454), opam solver cleanups (#11439), and unused package manager code removal (#11459)
  • Build system updates with Nix flake update to OCaml 5.2 (#11458) and CI improvements removing unsupported compiler versions (#11449)
entry.summary: Active week with directory targets fixes, inline test improvements, and package handling enhancements across 23 commits

entry.title: Week 5, 2025: Active refactoring of SAT solver and pkg modules with new dune init dash support
entry.content:
Summary

New PR for dune tools env PATH configuration opened alongside extensive SAT solver refactoring

Activity

  • New PR opened by @art-w to add dune tools env command for configuring PATH with local dev tools binaries (#11408)
  • SAT solver optimizations with multiple merged PRs removing unnecessary operations, speeding up duplicate removal, and improving clause handling (342587c, c26fd8b, 776d5d8)
  • Package management refactoring including opam file parsing speedups, dependency evaluation improvements, and transient set caching (342587c, c0e3bb6, b4bf4b9)
  • Code cleanup activities including FAQ improvements avoiding title case and solver error stacktrace inclusion (e43cb9d, 45d421f)
entry.summary: Active refactoring of SAT solver and pkg modules with new dune init dash support

entry.title: Week 4, 2025: Dune 3.17.2 release with Melange fixes, plus performance optimizations and code refactoring
entry.content:
Summary

Version 3.17.2 release with Melange fixes, plus extensive code refactoring across SAT solver and foreign library components

Activity

  • Dune 3.17.2 release published by Etienne fixing Melange compilation crashes, JS emission flags, and virtual library handling (3.17.2)
  • Melange rule improvements by Antonio Nuno Monteiro fixing public library implementation compilation crashes and private implementation restrictions (#11248, #11252, #11253)
  • Performance optimization work including SAT solver literal array conversion (2d1c89bebe09bbf3ccd1164b5ac61cbdfb2f4b04), solution type simplification (e32e82d46fcbcd9fd43d317d8e57fe14e3fe9e9c), and abstract rank type implementation (bc877f614ca45887c466d9e2accc92676f607bc3)
  • Code refactoring across foreign library components including API improvements (f5984c79d6674fd595728b8c7c5e898aea4bdc69), library rules cleanup (5a0c4da0534edc6caa7173231a60dd5cb5deed3d), and recursive includes restructuring (465df690227beea9bb173cf6702402c00ff5883f)
  • OCaml 4.08 compatibility fixes addressing breaking changes (aa40c3f3286775d97d9541752799d349ab2eecdd, 7b19481d713b8dbdf089294ad780871197363ea1)
entry.summary: Dune 3.17.2 release with Melange fixes, plus performance optimizations and code refactoring

entry.title: Week 51, 2024: Dune 3.17.1 released with bug fixes for dynlink, file corruption, and empty project errors
entry.content:
Summary

Dune 3.17.1 maintenance release preparation with package solver refactoring and Melange improvements

Activity

  • Release preparation completed for Dune 3.17.1 with changelog updates and version finalization (7025204)
  • Package solver refactoring effort including removal of deprecated dependency importance levels and dead solver code cleanup (#11236, #11233, #11223, #11228, #11227)
  • Melange backend improvements with compilation efficiency enhancements and code structure simplification (#11207, #11211, #11206)
  • CI infrastructure cleanup with removal of coveralls integration (#11224)
entry.summary: Dune 3.17.1 released with bug fixes for dynlink, file corruption, and empty project errors

entry.title: Week 50, 2024: Documentation improvements for package management and bug fixes for IO operations
entry.content:
Summary

Focus on documentation and stability improvements with package management reference and IO fixes

Activity

  • Package management documentation received comprehensive treatment with new reference sections for pinning, workspace configuration, and repository management (25be1eac)
  • Code stability improvements through IO module reentrancy fix (ef02bd72) and regression testing for issue #11200 (38c07430)
  • Documentation refinements including typo fixes (5f4cd06d) and clearer library field descriptions (046fe80a)
entry.summary: Documentation improvements for package management and bug fixes for IO operations

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: New format-dune-file action, configure script prefix support, and Windows compatibility improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Ten merged PRs focused on formatting, configuration, and package management with changelog consolidation

Activity

  • Format-dune-file implementation merged with comprehensive action support including new S-expression formatting capabilities by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r (#11166)
  • Configure script enhancement adding --prefix flag support for installation configuration by Rudi Grinberg (#11172)
  • Library compilation optimization with (no_dynlink) flag preventing unnecessary .cmxs file generation by NicolÃ¡s Ojeda BÃ¤r (#11176)
  • Package management robustness improvements including lock file validation for @pkg-install alias (#11153) and git repository fragment support (#11147)
  • Repository configuration update with source field renamed to url in repository stanzas (#11183)
  • Wasmofocaml action updates for improved web compilation support (#11184)
  • Changelog consolidation from 3.17.0 release with numerous historical changes merged back (#11180)
  • Testing infrastructure fixes including ignored-dune-lock test compatibility on macOS (#11179)
  • Dune language version progression bumped to 3.18 enabling new feature development (#11175)
  • Install.Roots refactoring with new to_dyn function for debugging support (#11178, #11171)
entry.summary: New format-dune-file action, configure script prefix support, and Windows compatibility improvements

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Dune 3.17.0 release with major new features including wasm_of_ocaml support, Dune cache enabled by default, and package management improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Major Dune 3.17.0 release published with comprehensive new features and Windows package management planning

Activity

  • Dune 3.17.0 release published by Etienne featuring extensive new capabilities including wasmofocaml support, Dune cache enabled by default, and enhanced JavaScript compilation control
  • Windows package management initiative launched by Stephen Sherratt with comprehensive tracking issue identifying 10+ specific areas requiring Windows support (#11161)
  • New compiler flag support for OCaml 5.2's -H flag enabling correct semantics for (implicit_transitive_deps false) in this release
  • Enhanced development tools including individual test running with dune runtest mytest.t, Codeberg repository support, and project defaults configuration
  • Performance and usability improvements with new cache settings, improved terminal color readability, and configurator enhancements
entry.summary: Dune 3.17.0 release with major new features including wasm_of_ocaml support, Dune cache enabled by default, and package management improvements

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: New @pkg-install alias, enhanced runtest hints, improved solver diagnostics, and bug fixes across package management and Merlin integration
entry.content:
Summary

Internal refactoring focused on super context removal for formatting rules, solver library transitions, and test improvements

Activity

  • Package management infrastructure improvements with solver diagnostics transition from Fmt to Pp library by Etienne Millon (#11126)
  • Formatting rules refactoring by Rudi Grinberg removing super context dependencies across multiple PRs (#11151, #11150, #11149, #11148)
  • Test infrastructure enhancements including reproduction case for issue #11140 (#11142) and failing cache test by mefyl (#11116)
  • Documentation updates including dependency updates in documentation itself (#10932) and new alias documentation (#11137)
  • macOS compatibility fixes for patch expect tests by Stephen Sherratt (#11132)
entry.summary: New @pkg-install alias, enhanced runtest hints, improved solver diagnostics, and bug fixes across package management and Merlin integration

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: Coq coqdep flags support added and JS_of_OCaml whole program compilation fixed
entry.content:
Summary

Focus on Coq tooling improvements and JavaScript compilation bug fixes

Activity

  • Coq development enhancements by Rodolphe Lepigre implementing coqdep flags support in dune environments and project files with comprehensive test coverage
  • JavaScript compilation fixes by JÃ©rÃ´me Vouillon resolving whole program compilation issues affecting both JSofOCaml and WebAssembly targets
  • Package management improvements by Ambre Austen Suhamy refactoring 0install solver internals and updating OCaml 5.2 compatibility
  • Test infrastructure additions including reproduction cases for ignored dune.lock files and pin stanza git source handling
entry.summary: Coq coqdep flags support added and JS_of_OCaml whole program compilation fixed

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: None
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/dune - Week 45, 2024
entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/dune - Week 45, 2024

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: New OCamlformat wrapper, individual test running, pkgconf integration, and toolchain feature promotion
entry.content:
Summary

Release 3.16.1 with C++ compiler fix, major 0install solver unvendoring, and extensive internal refactoring

Activity

  • Release 3.16.1 published by Etienne with C++ compiler fix for OCaml >= 5.0 by Kate
  • Major unvendoring effort by Ambre Austen Suhamy moving 0install-solver and opam-0install from vendor to src directory with updated auto-formatting and simplified types (a175dda)
  • Package dependency system improvements with new filtered_formula representation for dependencies (b409963)
  • Extensive internal refactoring by Rudi Grinberg across multiple modules including lib entries loading optimizations, bootstrap info improvements, and compile context simplifications
  • Test organization improvements with stanza tests reorganized under dedicated stanzas/ directory structure and test-related functionality streamlined
entry.summary: New OCamlformat wrapper, individual test running, pkgconf integration, and toolchain feature promotion

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Code refactoring week with dune subst fix for non-repository environments and package management improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Major code organization effort with command modularization and internal refactoring across multiple subsystems

Activity

  • Command modularization initiative extracted dune fmt (b61e9d61) and dune runtest (c1c2dec8) into separate modules for improved code organization
  • Internal refactoring across merlin index rules (2fa3ab4b) and function parameter renaming for better clarity (66c7ecdf)
  • Package management infrastructure improvements including binary package repository integration and enhanced dependency error handling
entry.summary: Code refactoring week with dune subst fix for non-repository environments and package management improvements

entry.title: Week 42, 2024: Package management improvements, formatting enhancements, and bug fixes for `dune exec` crash and dependency resolution
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple package management improvements, bug fixes for watch mode crashes, and build system refactoring

Activity

  • Package management enhancements included lazy dependency closure computation (#11025), explicit build targets in tests (#11024), and OCaml syntax support in dune files (#11026)
  • Bug fixes resolved dune exec -w crash with package management (#10960) and dependency filtering with version constraints (#11021)
  • Code improvements added memo stacktraces for better debugging (#11023) and moved standard aliases to dedicated rules (#11030)
  • Test coverage expanded with new test case for issue #10927 (#11027) and dependency filtering scenarios (#11021)
entry.summary: Package management improvements, formatting enhancements, and bug fixes for `dune exec` crash and dependency resolution

entry.title: Week 41, 2024: Package management improvements and Merlin integration enhancements with several bug fixes merged
entry.content: Activity report for ocaml/dune - Week 41, 2024
